Veigar is only broken if you let him get broken.  His Passive is what can break him, but he has to earn it.  He permanently gains 1 AP for killing any minion with his Q, and 1 for every skill he hits a champion with.  But he is also the king of squishy and easy to counter.

His stun field is pretty easy to both avoid and counter.  {{champion:25}} , for example, can Black Shield and walk right through it.  {{champion:15}} can essentially do the same thing.

I know this is old and stuff, but veigar isn't exactly broken. Late game he becomes a 1 click monster, but early game he is bad. If you play champions like Swain, Leblanc or Orianna, you can counter Veigar pretty hard:
Swain's high early game damage and sustain, as well as CC is perfect on immobile targets, like Veigar. Swain can shut the game down early, before your adc can feed him.
Leblanc has very high mobility, enough that she can quickly leave his circle as Veigar is summoning it. Her dashes/teleports also help her dodge his other basic abilities. To top it off, her early game, and late game burst is crazy high, allowing her to dash in, delete, then dash out, preventing Veigar from getting kills.
Orianna has very high and flexible range with her ball, which can help her burst Veigar from afar. Her ult can pull veigar or others into (or out of) the circle, helping your team get kills. Even if a fight goes south and you need to retreat, Orianna's W can help your whole team disengage.

The trick to stopping Veigar is to not only shut him down early, but the game as well. Split pushing top laners can help achieve the latter. Basically the true counter to Veigar is early game pressure
